comments.body: Hey bro why are you doing this here this is the wrong board to talk about gambling try moving it here https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=56.0I think you rush to do this.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: So.. what "tools" did that person actually gave you?I wouldn't suggest Googling "evergreen crypto information" though, because it led me to some links towards some shitcoin called "Evergreen token".

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: and the OP just lost some reputation by being a crapcoin promoterit has nothing to do with bitcoin. heck its a PoS(at best quick glance) but says people need to open an account on a website, so looks centralised too.. nothing like bitcoinhey seabiscuit, wanna see a bad player.. .. get a mirror

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: your topic is "bitcoin" a valuable technologythen you talk about and advertise a PoS centralised altcoin that has got nothing to do with bitcoinwell seems you are trying to not help teach people about bitcoin after allmoving on

comments.author: lionheart78
comments.body: Right information dissemination is the key and not promoting other crappy cryptocurrencies or altcoins.  If you talk about Bitcoin and mention an altcoin and give emphasis on it, isn't it misleading?  You are defrauding people who are interested on Bitcoin but instead of explaining and giving links to information about Bitcoin, you give a hint that directs people to an altcoin.  That is bad playing IMO.Quote from: mk4 on February 05, 2023, 05:12:01 PMSo.. what "tools" did that person actually gave you?I wouldn't suggest Googling "evergreen crypto information" though, because it led me to some links towards some shitcoin called "Evergreen token".I also tried googling it but it gives an Evergreencoin that claims to be a descendant of Bitcoin and now is running with POE, Proof of Environment.  I don't know how it works though and I have no intention of discussing it here.
